title.narrative: Subnational Government Public Sector Modernization Program

description.narrative: The project aims at improving the capabilities of the provincial governments and their municipalities to more effectively manage their resources and improve the quality of government administrative services. Its specific objectives are: i) to support the integrated development and adoption of basic management tools tha t are conducive to the efficient and transparent management of provincial and mu nicipal resources; ii) to strengthen provincial governments in such key areas as those related to land tax and tax administration, human resources management, j udicial services, civil registries, control entities and public safety functions ; and iii) to support the strengthening of municipal governments through pilot a ctivities designed to demonstrate the benefits of integrated modernization effor ts.

title.narrative: Number of provinces which improved Data Center service capacity in at least 25%

comment.narrative: New indicator following restructuring
Achieved. Santa Fe has a Data Center with an increased capacity of 300% and Salta has increased its capacity by 80%.

title.narrative: In at least one province five ormore organizational units (i.e. courts, tribunals) of their judiciary system are integrated through an on-line management system

comment.narrative: New indicator following restructuring

Achieved. Santa Fe has 9 courts integrated through the system. Since this was a pilot, future implementation will depend onavailability of funding. The province estimates that is would need an additional USD 2.5 million to replicate the pilot to therest of the courts.

title.narrative: Number of provinces with reduced administration cost of Data Center in at least 20%

comment.narrative: New indicator following restructuring
Achieved. Santa Fe has reduced its costs by 20% and Salta by 45%.

title.narrative: Number of provinces with integrated management systems working in the Real State Property administration of the province

comment.narrative: New indicator following restructuring
One province Formosa has an integrated system, Mendoza is at 75% completion of its project.

title.narrative: Number of provinces with integrated management systems working in their Revenue Agency with "on-line" services

comment.narrative: New indicator following restructuring
Achieved in provinces Formosa and Chubut.

title.narrative: Number of provinces with integrated management systems working in the territorial cadastre administration of the province with online services

comment.narrative: New indicator following restructuring

Achieved in 2 provinces Chubut and Formosa. In Formosa all the municipal cadastres are integrated on-line. In Chubut only 2municipal cadastres are connected but these 2 make up for about 80% of the population.

title.narrative: Number of provinces with an interface between terrtorial cadastre administration of the province with online services

comment.narrative: New indicator following restructuring
Partially Achieved. Formosa has achieved 100% of the interface.

title.narrative: In at least one Province, the time to send information from registries to the cadastre has decreased from 30 days to on-line access

comment.narrative: Revised indicator following restructuring.
online access

Achieved. Formosa has on-line registry. Mendoza has partially achieved target. New registries are on-line but they are in theprocess of scanning old documents to put on-line. This task will be completed at the end of 2013 (after project closing).

title.narrative: In at least one Province, the time for key services and administrative processes (such as the informe de valuación) has been reduced from 15 to 10 days.

comment.narrative: Revised indicator following restructuring.
Achieved. In the Provinces of Formosa and Chubut the process for producing "informe de valuacion" which is the fiscal valuationof property has been reduced to 10 days.

title.narrative: In at least one Province, the percentage of registered properties in an electronic format has increased from 90% to 95%.

comment.narrative: Revised indicator following restructuring.

Achieved. In one province - Formosa the target has been reached since 95% registered properties are on-line in a database called"indice de titulares". Mendoza is also likely to reach this target in the short term.

title.narrative: In at least one province, the ratio of collected provincial taxes has increased in 15% in real terms.

comment.narrative: Revised target following restructuring.
Achieved. Formosa shows and increase of 40% and Chubut of 25% in collection of taxes between September of 2010 and September of2012.

title.narrative: Number of provinces with an interface between territorial cadastre administration and Real State Property Register Systems

comment.narrative: Achieved in Formosa and Chubut.

title.narrative: In at least one Province, percentage of public employees included in the integrated personnel information and payroll systems has increased from 0% to 30%.

comment.narrative: Achieved. 40% of employees are integrated to the system in the province of Chubut and integration into the system will continueuntil it reaches 100%.

title.narrative: In at least one province, the percentage of provincial staff operating under integrated payroll information systems in human resources has increased from 0% to 30%.

comment.narrative: Achieved. This is being implemented in the province of Chubut. 40% of staff have been integrated into the electronic payrollsystem and personnel information system.

title.narrative: In at least one Province, hours required to produce a certificate of years of service for public employees has decrease from 15 to 10 days.

comment.narrative: Achieved. Reduction achieved in Chubut.

title.narrative: In at least one province, the exchange of information between property registries and cadastre systems is done on a regular basis.

comment.narrative: Achieved. Chubut: and Formosa: 100%. In these provinces the information is exchanged on a regular basis
